Name: Huscarl Captain
Description: A captain of the fame Huscarl warriors who are one of the fiercest infantries in Europe. Loyal to the king he swear an oath to, this Huscarl captain will fight to the death along with his troop.

Name: Thane
Description: Saxon thane (or thegn) is the landowner, which is considered to be a minor noble title in Saxon England. Thanes are responsible for governing their local land and raising the militia (fyrd) to respond to the call of war by their king. After the Norman invasion, William the Conqueror replace Saxon political structure with Norman's one and integrate the thane class to Norman knight class.

Name: High Medieval Minor Noble
Description: In the time of inefficient record, it is impossible to keep track the name of every person who was the leader of the army units let alone participated in the battle. History oftentimes remembers only the major nobles who were the top in the chain of command, but it is important to know that no army can be led by such a few individuals even for an organised mass. These minor nobles were one of such people that often joined their lord army as a minor leader or warrior.

Name: High Medieval Noble
Description: Not even an important noble would be assuredly recorded in the chronicle of a battle in the time of pre-industrialisation period. The majority of battles in world history did not have historians to record the event or its existence as the well-known battles we know today, some may even be lost to the flow time, accident or intentional erasing. These unnamed nobles still without a doubt aided their sovereign as commanders of the contingent in the battle.

Name: Knight
Description: A Knight is more than just a warrior. Honour and chivalry in warfare are what differentiate us from mere animals for even in conflicts against the most hated enemy we fought with civility.

Name: Warlord
Description: In chaotic time only those who can wage war the best are often the winner. A Warlord, as the name suggests, sees warfare as their opportunity to seize power. Let those who know war best lead an army into battle.

Name: Hero
Description: Sometimes a presence of a single person can decide to course of battle. These people are often referred to as Hero in the book of history. A Hero leads their followers by example, the men will fight valiantly when the person they love and respect fight alongside them.

Name: Champion
Description: A champion can represent the might of an army just as well as thousands of men. Why waste lives when a battle can end with a single death?

Name: Citizen
Description: It is hard to tell what can a simple Citizen accomplish in battle let alone warfare. Maybe they are a hidden gem waiting to be polished or simply a nuisance?

Name: Slave
Description: Slave revolt can signal the end of an empire. Even those with the worst malnutrition can fight if their lives are upon it. Nevertheless, expect nothing too extravagant.

Name: Slave Master
Description: Slaves are properties. They are trained to obey every command of their master even if that command is to die. A Slave Master will make sure that their servitude is absolute.

Name: Standard-bearer
Description: An army or royal standard represents the symbol of an army and its leader. Such a symbol not only boost soldiers' morale but can even inflict fear into the enemy heart. A standard-bearer will make sure that everyone on the battlefield can spot this magnificent symbol without fail.

Name: Chieftain
Description: Even the most basic form of human society has seen the face of war. A Chieftain knows full well that the very survival of their community is not only to fence off nature but also other hostile civilisation.

Name: Berserker
Description: A brave warrior that does not fear death inspire courage in friends and inflict fear on enemies at the same time. A Berserker will fight to their last breath before facing their own death.

Name: Bard
Description: A good song to inspire bravery and morale. A Bard and their melody may not be that useful in combat but everyone loves an epic battle theme.

Name: Steward
Description: The economy is as crucial as the military might in warfare. A careful calculation will go a long way to prevent the country from going bankrupt even if victory is assured.

Name: Spy
Description: Knowing enemy plan is two steps ahead toward victory. A Spy will let you informed of every move the enemy is taking so a counter plan can be formed. Even if those moves are simply enemy charging head-on.

Name: Assassin
Description: All is fair in love and all. Dishonourable does not matter for a victory that can prevent death. An Assassin will undertake this honour to accomplish what none can.

Name: Hunter
Description: The problem of the logistical supply route can be circumvented somewhat by either pillaging or scavenging. The latter option allows an army to proceed in a less noticeable march and of course create less hatred among the local populace. A Hunter skilled enough in this task can lead a fruitful hunt to fill the bellies of the troops.

Name: Sniper
Description: If a battle can be won by a single death then there is no need for an army. A Sniper can gamble with their skill to kill a general from faraway and cause panic among enemies.

Name: Messenger
Description: Information is one of the most crucial components of any strategy. A Messenger can make sure that the chain of command is never broken even in the midst of a battle.

Name: Monk
Description: Even a man of faith can partake in a war that is righteous. The presence of a Monk in battle reassure the soldiers that God is indeed on their side.

Name: Artist
Description: Who can capture the glorious victory than those who have seen it with their owns eyes? With superb ability to translate the greatest deed any leader can accomplish into eternal memory, Artist will make sure your name is forever etched into the fabric of history until the end of time.

Name: Historian
Description: Humanity's history is incomplete without the subject of conflict. And what is a better way to be remembered with a Historian on your side? All deeds must not be left unwritten lest your enemies will write them for you.

Name: Diviner
Description: A Diviner can observe and interpret any sign from heaven beyond human calculation. A positive sign can greatly boost the morale of the entire army, while a negative one allows a leader to recalculate their move to avoid catastrophe.

Name: Builder
Description: Sometimes war cannot be won in a day or a single battle. Having a Builder accompany the army to war can make the encampment process much more efficient or maybe they can even assist in the rebuilding of the conquered city or fort.

Name: Chef
Description: Soldiers cannot fight at their best with a hungry stomach. Even though a Chef cannot provide any assistance directly in a battle or combat. They can greatly improve the rations and quality of mealtime.

Name: Inventor
Description: A glimpse into the weakness and practicality of inventions in warfare can only be gained from direct experience, not in a peaceful box of a building that knows no bloodshed. Bringing an Inventor into battle will allow them to absorb all necessary knowledge to bring forth true destruction.

Name: Forger
Description: Deception to create confusion. A Forger can fabricate a command letter or intelligence. The direction of force is prone to manipulation when such force can not even think for itself.

Name: Woodcutter
Description: Some war machine and building materials are just impossible to transport along the army's march. A Woodcutter will ensure that the resource gather process of the most important base material, namely wood, is as efficient as possible.

Name: imy-rA mSa
Description: Ancient egypt army overseer or vizier.

Name: Ur
Description: Ur is one of the word that refer to a person of status in the Ancient Egypt language. Nobles in the Ancient Egypt society are only below the Pharoah himself and usually serve as a high ranking leader of the military.
